intro: Dracaena enchiridiofolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dracaena, is a species native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its upright, slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically followed by red or orange berries. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements. Dracaena enchiridiofolia thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light.
